metadata.title: USN-6621-1 -- ImageMagick vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that ImageMagick incorrectly handled certain values when processing BMP files. An attacker could exploit this to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6621-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libmagick++-6.q16hdri-dev - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagickcore-6.q16-6-extra - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagickwand-dev - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagickwand-6.q16-6 - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6-extra - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagick++-dev - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 perlmagick - 8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1.3ubuntu0.22.04.3+esm3 libmagick++-6.q16hdri-8 -
